title: San Juan Island National Historical Park: Beaches
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Things To Do     Outdoor Activities     Beaches                Beaches      Fourth of July Beach/Old Town Lagoon South Beach Garrison Bay      South Beach (once called the Salmon Banks Beach) at American Camp is longest stretch of public shoreline in the San Juan Islands and part of six miles of saltwater shore overall at both park units. Purse seiner fishing boats ply these waters for salmon in July and August NPS Photo
